title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message: I'm familar with the logic boards that existed before usb C.  This data bus should be working with or without a battery? u7000 was replaced and the resistance of r5380/r5381 both measure around 2k.  ppdcin is 20v and ppbus is 0v and I think it's because smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is missing. the battery has a charge and the data bus comes back when it is attached. this seems like a pmic issue

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message:
SCL/SDA lines of battery bus must have very similar reading (less than 1% difference) in diode mode to ground.
Also voltage should be 3.3V approx, w/ and w/o battery connected.

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message: check it with no current or with current?

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message:
I hope you didn't measure diode mode with power applied.

There is big difference; denotes a problem on SDA line.
I was waiting voltage level on both lines too.

I also asked you to measure in 2 scenarios.
How do I know which values posted???
Was without battery?

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message:
scl is 3.3v with or without the battery connected
sda is 3.3v with the battery and 0.9v without the battery connected
diode mode is .449 for scl and .412 for sda

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message: is it safe to measure in diode mode with the battery attached?

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message:
The pull-up resistors for battery bus are connected to MLB.
No problem to measure with battery, if charger is not connected.

Remove D6950 and check again.

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message: it was still the same reading with d6950 removed but reflowed u7800 and now it powers up. i misplaced d6950 so can i just run a wire from ground to sys_detect_l?

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message: There is no relation between D6950 and SYS_DETECT_L.

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message: the board works without d6950? battery won't charge properly without d6950?

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message:
SYS_DETECT_L is pulled down to ground (as needed) through R6950.
D6950 is only used as spike protection for battery data bus.

title: 820-00239 smbus_smc_5_g3_sda is 0v when the battery isn't attached
message: the board is working without it but i'll be responsible and replace d6950
